before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ddbr","text":"Before starting make sure to have isolated bacterial DNA and selected primers for amplification.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fdtk","text":"This protocol is used for the amplification of the bacterial gyrB gene and the 16S gene for both PacBio Sequel II and Illumina MiSeq sequencing. This protocol is used in the paper titled Long-read Sequencing Increases the Accuracy and Specificity of the gyrB Phylogenetic Marker Gene. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":61,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":187,"length":96}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f82j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5612t","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2dghk","text":"Figure out how much DNA to add by dividing 1000 by the average DNA concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eoi4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ah6t","text":"For example: if your average DNA concentration was   you would take 1000/254 which equals 3.94. steps.section: Prepare DNA for Amplification
